title: Drawing, "Ceiling of a Small Cabinet, Palazzo Quirinale, Rome", 1812
medium: Pen and dark gray ink, brush and gray wash over black chalk ruled lines on light greenish-beige wove paper
provenance: Giovanni Piancastelli; Mr. and Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: Four sides of vaulted ceiling indicated by four trapezoidal shapes. In center of each is small rectangular composition with god in chariot: on long sides, Venus in dove-drawn chariot and Poseidon in horse-drawn chariot; on short sides, Diana in stag-drawn chariot and Apollo in horse-drawn chariot. Surrounding these compositions, pairs of decorative motifs: female figures with herms, winged genii, dancing genii, and octagons with dancing female figures, and masks in circles.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Ceiling of a Small Cabinet, Palazzo Quirinale, Rome", 1812.
1812. Pen and dark gray ink, brush and gray wash over black chalk ruled lines on light greenish-beige wove paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-3090.
